content.description: The diagonal slant to the vertical crack makes for a good warm-up. Sit start on the left end of where the slanted crack comes down to meet the ground. The crux is actually middle of the traverse. Traverse right until you gain a huge jug on the vertical crack. Go up, and exit through the slot at the top. Going straight up on the vertical crack up was V0-/V-easy, so hopefully this adds a little more to the route and makes it more fun.
content.protection: A pad for the vertical part. The traverse is low enough, and the ground is soft that you won't need a pad.
content.location: Start towards the left end of the crag where the ground slopes up to meet the rock.

pathTokens: Quarry Road/Bellevue Pond at Middlesex Fells

content.description: It may look shorter than the north cliff from afar, but when you get there, it is about the same size. Just like its northern neighbor, there is a 2 bolt highball problem that has a bad landing, and just like its neighbor, the bolted route is the most aesthetically please at the crag. Good spotter(s) and multiple pads would be needed to tackle that problem. There are a few problems to its left and right.
